thread.title: Continuum Honors Veterans at Navigate 2015 User Conference
thread.title_full: Continuum Honors Veterans at Navigate 2015 User Conference

author: admin
title: Continuum Honors Veterans at Navigate 2015 User Conference
text:
Continuum Managed IT Services 
LAS VEGAS & BOSTON -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Continuum ® , the industry's only channel-exclusive provider of fully integrated managed IT services solutions, announced at Navigate 2015 that the Mayor of the City of Las Vegas, County of Clark, State of Nevada, proclaimed September 29, 2015 as Continuum Veterans Foundation Day. Established in 2012 by Continuum, the Continuum Veterans Foundation is a nonprofit organization providing financial support to local and national charities that focus on helping veterans find jobs in IT. This Smart News Release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20150930006295/en/ Michael George, CEO at Continuum and Mayor Carolyn G. Goodman, City of Las Vegas (Photo: Business Wire) 
During Navigate 2015, which was held on Sunday, September 27 – Tuesday, September 29, 2015 at The Cosmopolitan™ of Las Vegas, prior to a packed day of sessions and a technology showcase, Continuum played a special video honoring U.S. military veterans for the sold out crowd of more than 600, mostly comprised of the company’s Managed Services Provider (MSP) partners. Michael George , CEO at Continuum, asked the 46 veterans in the audience to stand and be recognized. Shannon Mayer , Continuum’s Senior Marketing Programs Manager, sang the National Anthem. 
“We are honored to have September 29, 2015 proclaimed as Continuum Veterans Foundation Day in the City of Las Vegas,” said Michael George, CEO at Continuum. “Any time we get to recognize, honor and thank a veteran is a good day. And during Navigate 2015, we had the opportunity to thank our many MSP partners who were in attendance at our user conference and have served this great nation.” 
For more information on the Continuum Veterans Foundation, visit: http://cvf.continuum.net/ 
About Continuum Veterans Foundation Continuum Veterans Foundation is a nonprofit organization providing financial support to local and national charities that focus on helping veterans find jobs in IT. The Foundation was established in 2012 by Continuum ® , the technology industry's only channel-exclusive provider of fully integrated managed IT services solutions, directing a portion of the revenue from its Help Desk offerings to select nonprofit veteran organizations. For more information, visit: http://cvf.continuum.net/ . 
About Navigate 2015 Navigate 2015, held on Sunday, September 27 – Tuesday, September 29, 2015 at The Cosmopolitan™ of Las Vegas, is a 3-day educational and training event for the industry’s top MSP partners and IT resellers led by top business and channel leaders. Sold out with more than 600 attendees, Navigate 2015 features more than 30 sponsors and exhibitors and more than 60 speakers, to help MSPs take their business to the next level through partner success stories and sales and marketing tactics. For more information on Navigate 2015, visit: http://www.continuum.net/navigate2015 . For the latest updates, follow #nav15 on Twitter. 
About Continuum Managed IT Services Continuum is the technology industry's only channel-exclusive provider of fully integrated managed IT services, allowing its Managed Services Provider (MSP) partners to maintain both on premise and cloud-based servers, desktops, mobile devices and other endpoints for small-and-medium-sized businesses. Continuum’s SaaS platform enables MSPs to efficiently backup, monitor, troubleshoot and maintain clients’ IT infrastructurefrom a single pane of glass, all backed by an industry–leading network operations center (NOC) and Help Desk. The company employs over 1,000 professionals worldwide, supports 3,500 partners servicing 50,000 SMB customers and monitors over 700,000 endpoints. In 2012, Continuum established the Continuum Veterans Foundation, a nonprofit organization providing financial support to charities focused on helping veterans find jobs in IT. For more information, visit http://www.continuum.net/ or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @FollowContinuum . All trademarks recognized.
